result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Patrick W Boyd was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Patrick W Boyd was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber--May serve in Eau Claire County if no cost to Washburn County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick W Boyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Patrick W Boyd appeared with Attorney Michael R. Cohen.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Court speaks to the parties.  Atty Cohen speaks to the court re: plea agreement. Court questions the def. re: his plea questionaire and waiver of rights form. Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights.  State moves to amend count 1 to a misd. OWI 4th.  Court grants motion.   Court finds there is a factual basis.  State speaks re: sentencing.  Atty Cohen speaks to the court.  Court speaks to the defendant.  

Count 1-Def. pleas guilty. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty.  Sentencing---$4,153.00   350 Days County Jail---Huber-1 day credit.    18 month 11D    DL Revoked for 36 months.  AODA Assessment
May serve in Eau Claire County if no cost to Washburn County. 


Count 2- Def. pleas guilty. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty.  $299.00 fine + costs  Firearm may be released from evidence.

Court is satisfied. Mr. Boyd is bound over for trial.
